conclusion: Analyze forces to find coefficient of friction (μ) and angle (θ).
Weight (W) calculated as W = mg, where m = 15 kg and g = 10 m/s².
Normal force (N) is perpendicular to the surface.
Pulling force (F) is 90 N at angle θ.
Frictional force (f) is proportional to normal force, f = μN.
Resolve pulling force into horizontal (F_x) and vertical (F_y) components.
F_x = F cos θ and F_y = F sin θ.
Vertical equilibrium: N + F_y = W, leading to N = 150 - 90 sin θ.
Horizontal equilibrium: F_x = f, leading to 90 cos θ = μN.
Substitute N into horizontal equation: 90 cos θ = μ(150 - 90 sin θ).
Assume θ = 37° and substitute values: 72 = μ × 96.
